result.execSummary:
Wesley Q Hair was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Wesley Q Hair was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wesley Q Hair

defendant.name: Hair, Wesley Q
defendant.address: 225 South Water St. East, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.addlTxt:
[ma: no record made] Defendant Wesley Q Hair not in court.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The Court has learned that Mr. Hair was released to Tennessee authorities. The Court takes no further action.
Hearing on September 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 4:26pm 
Defendant Wesley Q Hair in court, in custody.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

DA Hall indicates that multiple attempts have been made to reach out/contact Tennessee with no response. 

DA Hall cites written waiver portion of statute,  976.03(27).

DA Hall cites case law

DA Hall requests the Defendant be held a day or two, to allow State to attempt additional contacts with Tennessee. 

The Court directs DA Hall to continue attempts to contact Tennessee, and inform Tennessee that on 9/9/22 case will either be dismissed or Mr. Hair will be let out on bond. 

recess: 4:34pm  
NEXT: Hearing on 9/9/22 at 10:30am (dismiss or set bond, if not picked up by Tennessee) (JA please forward Notice to Def at Jail)

[ma] Case called at 10:02 AM 
Defendant Wesley Q Hair in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews court record. 

Upon inquiry of the Court, ADA Shock has no information to provide the Court as to why Mr. Hair has not been extradited by Tennessee. 

ADA Shock requests an adjournment to allow time to investigate. 

Mr. Hair indicates that he has attempted to attend to issues in Tennessee. 

The Court sets over until this afternoon. 

Mr. Hair makes inquiry about 'fighting' extradition. 

The Court informs Mr. Hair that he waived his right to an extradition hearing. 
recess: 10:08am 
NEXT: Status on 8/30/22 at 3:00pm
Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
to Surety - per 8/10/22 court order. 22C 014214
Status conference on August 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 1:36 PM 
Defendant Wesley Q Hair appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa.  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Atty De La Rosa indicates that Mr. Hair was advised by Tennessee authorities due to covid concerns not to turn himself in, but had no further instruction. 

The Court holds Mr. Hair without bond awaiting extradition.

The Court directs that the $500 bond be returned to poster; 8/25/22 forfeiture hearing to be removed. 

recess: 1:42pm 
NEXT: Status on 8/30/22 at 9:30am (has Mr. Hair been extradited?)
JAs Review of 8/1/22 RUMS
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (ae/8/3/22)
Extradition Forecast

[MK] case called at 12:02pm 
Defendant Wesley Q Hair not in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Status Conference as to the extradition-status. 
ADA Shock indicates that it appears that Mr. Hair has not been picked up by the Tennessee authorities and that the  Tennessee warrant is still active
On Motion of the State, the Court issues a Bench Warrant.  The Court finds that the posted $500 Cash Bond is in default.
recess 12:03pm

NEXT:  schedule Bail Forfeiture Hearing
JAs Review of 5/31/22 RUMS
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (05/31) - ML
Scheduling Order
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ml] Case called at 8:37AM
Defendant Wesley Q Hair does not appear. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Witt advises that he anticipates that the Defendant has been picked up by Law Enforcement and in Tennessee, however he feels that returning the bond and closing the case may be too premature yet.
The State requests that the Court set this matter over for an additional Status Confernece.
The Court sets this matter over, and takes no further action today.

recess 8:39AM

NEXT: Status Confernece on 07/11 at 10:00AM
JA's Review of 04/06/22 RUMS
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (04/06) ML
Bond + surety info
Status conference on May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
ec/pc: DA, JCJ, Governors Office (3/14/22--ma)

[ma] Case called at 1:39pm
Defendant Wesley Q Hair appears. Public Defender Cassi Nelson appears.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Atty. Nelson indicates that Mr. Hair is waiving extradition and wishes to do so without counsel.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
Date of birth confirmed

The Court is satisfied that Wesley Q Hair is the person before him and is a fugative of the requesting state.

Mr. Hair signs extradition waiver in the presence of the Court. 

Court endorses each document

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $500 CASH Bond. 
recess 1:52 pm. 

NEXT: Status Conference on 5/19/22 at 8:30am
Attachment to Complaint
